intro: Serissa corymbosa, commonly known as the Chinese serissa, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces tiny, round berries that turn red when mature, adding to its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight, making it a popular choice for bonsai and container gardening. Its evergreen foliage and ability to form intricate shapes make it a favored plant in horticultural practices.
